urls.title: If I'm flying with an infant, do I have to pay for a bassinet seat?
urls.description: If I'm flying with an infant, do I have to pay for a bassinet seat? Passengers travelling with infants together with their travelling party are entitled to a complimentary Standard Seat only. All other seat types e.g. extra legroom etc. remain chargeable. Depending on the aircraft, a number of bassinets are provided onboard, free of charge due to safety and storage reasons, passengers are not allowed to carry their own bassinets into the cabin. This Bassinet service must be requested at least 24 hours

urls.title: Malaysia Airlines | Book Direct With Us For The Best Fares
urls.description: Get the best deals to 60+ destinations, worldwide. As the national carrier, Malaysia Airlines offers the best way to fly to, from and around Malaysia.

urls.title: What is the excess baggage fee structure?
urls.description: What is the excess baggage fee structure? 1* Malaysia (Peninsular, Sabah & Sarawak) 8 2 Brunei, Cambodia, China, Hong Kong, Indonesia (Denpasar, Surabaya, Kuala Namu), Myanmar, Philippines, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam 10 3 Bangladesh, India, Indonesia (Jakarta), Japan, Republic of Korea, Nepal, Qatar, Sri Lanka, 15 *Passenger travelling on MH domestic services with a Government warrant/ order, the excess baggage rate on all domestic services will be USD5 per kilogram Can't find the

data.text:
@Supsthebest Pertaining to your other enquiry, do note that the excess baggage fee will be calculated per kilogram by our staff at the airport. For more information on the excess baggage fee structure, you may refer to this link:- [https://t.co/EWz7ZVnzWv]. -NB

 2/2

@Supsthebest Hi, @Supsthebest. We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience experienced. We will share your feedback with our department concerned for their action. We will take this feedback into account for the betterment of our services. 

1/2
